conversation.content: [quietly] You loaded everything?

[breathlessly] Yeah, all three trucks, just like we planned. [nervously] Though, um, I gotta tell you, those sirens started way earlier than you said they would, had me sweating bullets trying to get the last crates in.
Mmm, well, the timing was supposed to be perfect but someone must've, I don't know, tripped a silent alarm or something. [pause] Did you double-check the manifests like I told you?

[frustrated] Of course I checked them, what do you take me for? [sighs] Twenty years I've been loading trucks, legitimate and otherwise, and you still talk to me like I'm some rookie who doesn't know which end is up.

[apologetic] Hey, no, that's not—look, I'm just being careful, alright? [quietly] This haul is worth more than everything we've pulled combined, and if even one serial number gets traced back to us, we're finished.
[confidently] The numbers are clean, I made sure of that. [chuckles] Swapped out all the tracking labels with the fakes you printed, even wore the gloves the whole time so there's no prints anywhere.
[relieved] Good, that's good. [hesitantly] Listen, uh, there's something else though—the buyer wants to meet tomorrow instead of next week, says the heat's getting too intense to wait.

[suspiciously] Tomorrow? That's, hmm, that's really soon. [anxiously] We haven't even had time to let things cool down, and moving that much merchandise in broad daylight seems like asking for trouble, doesn't it?

[firmly] It's not ideal but we don't have a choice here. [exhales] The warehouse rental expires in forty-eight hours and, frankly, I'd rather move it now than risk someone finding three trucks full of stolen electronics sitting here.
[muted] Yeah, okay, I get it. [sighs] Just feels like we're pushing our luck after such a clean job, you know? But if you think it's the right call, then I'm with you.
[warmly] That's why you're my partner, always have been. [chuckles] Remember our first job together, that disaster with the jewelry store where you loaded everything into the wrong van?

[laughing] Oh man, don't remind me! [animated] We had to circle back three times because I kept mixing up the license plates, and you were so mad you wouldn't talk to me for a week afterward. [pause] Look how far we've come though.
[triumphant] From petty theft to this—three million in merchandise ready to move. [very quietly] Sometimes I can't believe we actually pulled it off, like maybe I'll wake up and it'll all be a dream.

[reassuringly] It's real, trust me. [exhales] My back's killing me from loading all those boxes, so yeah, definitely real. Tomorrow we finish this and then we can disappear for a while, just like we planned.
[nervously] Right, the plan. [clears throat] About that, um, I've been thinking maybe we should split up for a few months instead of traveling together, just to be extra safe.
[hurt] Split up? [confused] That wasn't what we discussed, I mean, we've always stuck together through everything. Why would you want to change that now when we're so close to being free?
[hesitantly] It's not about wanting to, it's about being smart. [sighs] Two people traveling together draws more attention than one, and after a score this big, we can't afford any mistakes.
[reluctantly] I guess that makes sense, even if I don't like it. [quietly] Just, uh, promise me we'll meet up again once things settle down, because doing this without you wouldn't mean much.

[sincerely] Six months, that's all. [warmly] We'll meet at that beach bar in Costa Rica we always talked about, drink those ridiculous cocktails with the little umbrellas, and figure out what comes next. [pause] Deal?

[smiling speaking] Deal. [chuckles] Six months of laying low and then cocktails on the beach with my partner in crime. [confidently] After everything we've been through, I think we've earned that much, don't you?

scenario: Two partners meet at a warehouse after their biggest heist yet - one who planned it, one who loaded the getaway trucks - but sirens in the distance suggest they may have been compromised.
